tit.cmt: hashihitohime→hashihito no himemiko と修正しました。（原文に忠実であるのと、ウェブ上等で確認しました）

sen.j: 穴穂部間人皇女（あなほべのはしひとのひめみこ、生年不詳 - 推古天皇29年12月21日 (旧暦)（622年2月6日））は、飛鳥時代の皇族。
sen.e: Anahobe no hashihitohime (year of birth unknown, died December 21, 29 [according to the lunar calendar][February 6, 622]) was a one of the Imperial family members during the Asuka Period.
Anahobe no hashihito no himemiko (year of birth unknown - February 6, 622) was a one of the Imperial Family members during the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: hashihitohime→hashihito no himemiko, カッコ内を修正しました。Imperial family→Imperial Family,Period→period と修正しました。
sen.e: Anahobe no hashihito no himemiko (year of birth unknown - February 6, 622) was a one of the Imperial Family members during the Asuka period.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 欽明天皇の皇女。
sen.e: She was a daughter of Emperor Kinmei.
She was a princess of the Emperor Kinmei.
sen.cmt: daughter→princess と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: She was a princess of the Emperor Kinmei.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 母は蘇我稲目の娘・蘇我小姉君。
sen.e: Her mother was (SOGA no) Oane no kimi whose father is SOGA no Iname.
Her mother was SOGA no Oane no kimi whose father is SOGA no Iname.
sen.cmt: カッコを削除しました。
sen.e: Her mother was SOGA no Oane no kimi whose father is SOGA no Iname.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 同母兄に穴穂部皇子。
sen.e: She had an elder brother-uterine, Prince Anahobe.
She had an older brother-uterine, the Prince Anahobe.
sen.cmt: elder→older と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: She had an older brother-uterine, the Prince Anahobe.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 異母兄・用明天皇の皇后となり、聖徳太子（聖徳太子）・来目皇子・殖栗皇子・茨田皇子を生む。
sen.e: She married her half-brother Emperor Yomei, and became a mother of Prince Shotoku, Prince Kume, Prince Ekuri (Eguri) and Prince Manda.
She married her older paternal half-brother, the Emperor Yomei, and became the mother of the Prince Shotoku, the Prince Kume, the Prince Ekuri (Eguri) and the Prince Manda.
sen.cmt: half-brother→older paternal half-brother,a→the と修正しました。the, カンマを補いました。
sen.e: She married her older paternal half-brother, the Emperor Yomei, and became the mother of the Prince Shotoku, the Prince Kume, the Prince Ekuri (Eguri) and the Prince Manda.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 用明天皇崩御後、用明天皇の第一皇子・田目皇子（多米王、聖徳太子の異母兄）に嫁し佐富女王（長谷王妃、葛城王・多智奴女王の母）を生む。
sen.e: After the demise of Emperor Yomei, she married Prince Tame (a first prince of Emperor Yomei and a half-brother of Prince Shotoku) and gave birth to Satomi no Himemiko (a wife of Ohatsuse no Oji, and a mother of Prince Kazuraki and 多智奴女王).
sen.cmt: 「読み方不明」調べましたが、多智奴女王の読み方が分かりませんでした。田目皇子と多米王は字が違うのみで読みは同じ「ためのみこ」なので、()内の多米王の記述は英文では省略しました。
sen.e: After the demise of the Emperor Yomei, she married the Prince Tame (the first prince of the Emperor Yomei and an older paternal half-brother of the Prince Shotoku) and gave birth to Satomi no Himemiko (the empress of Ohatsuse no Oji, and the mother of the Prince Kazuraki and 多智奴女王).
sen.cmt: the を補いました。a→the,a half-brother→an older paternal half-brother,a wife→the empress と修正しました。「多智奴女王」の読みは確認できておりません。
sen.e: After the demise of the Emperor Yomei, she married the Prince Tame (the first prince of the Emperor Yomei and an older paternal half-brother of the Prince Shotoku) and gave birth to Satomi no Himemiko (the empress of Ohatsuse no Oji, and the mother of the Prince Kazuraki and 多智奴女王).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: （『聖徳太子平氏伝雑勘文』 上ノ三 上宮太子御子孫竝后等事条 所引にある『上宮記』逸文に以下のような記述がある。
sen.e: ("聖徳太子平氏伝雑勘文" 上ノ三 上宮太子御子孫竝后等事条 所引にある The following sentence was quoted from defunct "Joguki" (Book of Japanese history written in the 7th century).
sen.cmt: 「意味解釈が困難なため訳出できず」「読み方不明」ウェブ等で調べましたが、「『聖徳太子平氏伝雑勘文』 上ノ三 上宮太子御子孫竝后等事条 所引にある」が読み方、意味解釈ともに分かりませんでした。そのため、『上宮記』逸文に～以降を英訳しています。「一原文一訳文例外対処」
sen.e: ("聖徳太子平氏伝雑勘文" 上ノ三 上宮太子御子孫竝后等事条 所引にある The following sentence was quoted from a lost writing of "Joguki" (Book of Japanese history written in the 7th century).

sen.j: 「多米王 父ﾊ用明 母ﾊ蘇我女也」
sen.e: "Prince Tame, his father was Emperor Yomei and his mother was a daughter of Soga no Iname.

sen.e: The Prince Tame, his father was the Emperor Yomei and his mother was a daughter of Soga.'

sen.e: The Prince Tame, his father was the Emperor Yomei and his mother was a daughter of Soga.'
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 「父天皇崩後 娶庶母間人孔部王生兒 佐富女王 一也」
sen.e: After the demise of Emperor Yomei, he married his mother-in-law Anahobe no hashihitohime and had a daughter, Satomi no Himemiko"
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.e: After the demise of the Emperor Yomei, he married his mother-in-law Anahobe no hashihitohime and had a daughter, Satomi no Himemiko.'

sen.j: 穴太部間人王、孔部間人公王、間人穴太部王、鬼前太后とも。
sen.e: Anahobe no hashihitohime was also called 穴太部間人王、孔部間人公王、間人穴太部王、鬼前太后.
sen.cmt: 「読み方不明」調べましたが、穴太部間人王、孔部間人公王、間人穴太部王、鬼前太后の読み方が分かりません
sen.e: Anahobe no hashihito no himemiko was also referred to as: 穴太部間人王、孔部間人公王、間人穴太部王、鬼前太后.
sen.cmt: hashihitohime→ hashihito no himemiko,called→referred to as: と修正しました。 なお、「穴太部間人王」、「孔部間人公王」、「間人穴太部王」、「鬼前太后」の読みは確認できておりません。
sen.e: Anahobe no hashihito no himemiko was also referred to as: 穴太部間人王、孔部間人公王、間人穴太部王、鬼前太后.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 尚、間人（はしひと）の名を持つ皇女が他に舒明天皇皇女及び孝徳天皇皇后としてもう一人いた。
sen.e: In addition to Anahobe no hashihitohime, there was another princess titled "Hashihito", who was a daughter of Emperor Jomei and a wife of Emperor Kotoku.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In addition to Anahobe no hashihito no himemiko, there was another princess titled "Hashihito", who was a princess of the Emperor Jomei and the empress of the Emperor Kotoku.
sen.cmt: hashihitohime→ hashihito no himemiko, カンマの位置の修正、daughter→princess,a wife→the empress と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: In addition to Anahobe no hashihito no himemiko, there was another princess titled "Hashihito", who was a princess of the Emperor Jomei and the empress of the Emperor Kotoku.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: こちらは単に間人皇女（はしひとのひめみこ）と呼ばれている。

sen.j: 用明天皇の皇后であった時に、厩の戸口で厩戸皇子（聖徳太子）を出産したという『日本書紀』の逸話は有名だ。
sen.e: There was a famous anecdote in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) that when Anahobe no hashihitohime was an empress of Emperor Yomei, she gave birth to Prince Umayado (Prince Shotoku) at Umaya no toguchi (a door of a stable).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There is a famous anecdote in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) that when Anahobe no hashihito no himemiko was the empress of the Emperor Yomei, she gave birth to the Prince Umayado (the Prince Shotoku) at Umaya no toguchi (a door of a stable).
sen.cmt: was→is,hashihitohime→ hashihito no himemiko,an→the と修正しました。the を補いました。
sen.e: There is a famous anecdote in "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan) that when Anahobe no hashihito no himemiko was the empress of the Emperor Yomei, she gave birth to the Prince Umayado (the Prince Shotoku) at Umaya no toguchi (a door of a stable).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これは中国に伝来したキリスト教の異端派である「景教」（ネストリウス派）がもたらした新約聖書の福音書にあるキリストの降誕を元にしたとの説がある。
sen.e: There is a theory that this anecdote was based on the story of the Nativity written in the Evangel of the New Testament which was the bible of the heterodoxy, Luminous Religion (Nestorians) introduced from China.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There is a theory that this anecdote was based on the story of the Nativity written in the Evangel of the New Testament, which was introduced to China by a heretic group of Christianity, 'Luminous Religion' (Nestorians).

sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 穴穂部間人皇女は蘇我氏と物部氏との争乱を避けて丹後に身を寄せ、都に戻る際に自分の名を贈った。
sen.e: Anahobe no hashihitohime moved to Tango in order to flee the conflict between SOGA and Mononobe clans, and when she returned to the capital, she allowed to use her name as a place-name.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処

sen.j: 丹後の人々は「皇后の御名をそのままお呼びするのは畏れ多い」として、皇后が（その地を）退座したことに因み「たいざ」と読むことにしたという。
sen.e: People in Tango were afraid of using the name of the empress directly, so they used "Taiza" (literally means "leave" in Japanese) as their place-name, because the name was given when Anahobe no hashihitohime left Taiza.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: People in Tango were afraid of using the name of the empress directly, so they used 'Taiza' (literally means "leave" in Japanese) as their place-name, connecting with that Anahobe no hashihitohime left Taiza.

sen.j: 但し、記紀などに穴穂部間人皇女が丹後に避難したとの記述はない。
